fields.description:
Errors are logged on ufs hosts when polling fails due to expected workflow not found conditions:

Example logging:

{code}
Mon Nov 28 19:10:48 2016 ERROR [LoadBalancingWorkflows:eucalyptus-loadbalancing-ephemeralconfiguration-loadbalancing-loadbalancingservice-worker-1041] [com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.LoadBalancingWorkflows.pollInstanceStatus(LoadBalancingWorkflows.java):439] Failed to signal PollInstanceStatus workflow
com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.model.UnknownResourceException: Status Code: 400, AWS Service: AmazonSimpleWorkflow, AWS Request ID: c57429fa-24e1-4d35-9634-6b171dce9f11, AWS Error Code: UnknownResourceFault, AWS Error Message: Unknown execution, workflowId = instance-status-000977514681-3fcfc487d6c9b904-ELBAddRemTest

        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.service.LoadBalancingService$14.call(LoadBalancingService.java:1055)

{code}

ws.java):424] Failed to signal update-loadbalancer workflow

lt, AWS Error Message: Unknown execution, workflowId = update-loadbalancer-000977514681-3fcfc487d6c9b904-ELBAddRemTest

        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.UpdateLoadBalancerWorkflowClientExternalImpl.updateImmediately(UpdateLoadBalancerWorkflowClientExternalImpl.java:41)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.LoadBalancingWorkflows.updateLoadBalancer(LoadBalancingWorkflows.java:422)

....
{code}

{code}
Mon Nov 28 19:11:46 2016 ERROR [LoadBalancingWorkflows:eucalyptus-bootstrap-servicecontext-common-worker-636] [com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.LoadBalancingWorkflows.updateLoadBalancer(LoadBalancingWorkflows.java):424] Failed to signal update-loadbalancer workflow
com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.model.UnknownResourceException: Status Code: 400, AWS Service: AmazonSimpleWorkflow, AWS Request ID: 977a08b0-3579-41b9-90b2-633ac080c62c, AWS Error Code: UnknownResourceFault, AWS Error Message: Unknown execution, workflowId = update-loadbalancer-000977514681-3fcfc487d6c9b904-ELBAddRemTest

        at com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.AmazonSimpleWorkflowClient.signalWorkflowExecution(AmazonSimpleWorkflowClient.java:1019)
        at com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.flow.worker.GenericWorkflowClientExternalImpl.signalWorkflowExecution(GenericWorkflowClientExternalImpl.java:78)
        at com.amazonaws.services.simpleworkflow.flow.DynamicWorkflowClientExternalImpl.signalWorkflowExecution(DynamicWorkflowClientExternalImpl.java:165)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.UpdateLoadBalancerWorkflowClientExternalImpl.updateImmediately(UpdateLoadBalancerWorkflowClientExternalImpl.java:41)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.LoadBalancingWorkflows.updateLoadBalancer(LoadBalancingWorkflows.java:422)
        at com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.service.LoadBalancingService.registerInstancesWithLoadBalancer(LoadBalancingService.java:1053)
{code}

We should handle these errors and not log errors / stack traces.
fields.summary: ELB should handle UnknownResourceFault when polling

comments.body:
Not sure if this should be handled under this issue or as a separate issue. The following IllegalStateException are (sometimes?) also logged before the UnknownResourceFault:

{code}

Id: instance-status-000791316698-3feda7d31b5d068d-ELBAddRemTest,RunId: 8ea293e2-2f37-41da-963f-113eac0292be}

java.lang.IllegalStateException: id=DecisionId [type=ACTIVITY, id=4], transitions=[CREATED, handleDecisionTaskStartedEvent, DECISION_SENT, handleInitiatedEvent, INITIATED, handleInitiationFailedEven

This is possibly an "expected" error when a workflow is deleted or may be a bug in our swf service (etc)
[~sjones] How did you trigger these error logs (deleting LB?)
[~spark], this was seen on the ufs host after the regular qa sequence.
I opened EUCA-12992 for the IllegalStateException error logging as it looks like a separate issue.

The UnknownResourceException is now silently ignored and this shouldn't cause functionality issue because the exception is caught only when a signal is delivered to the workflow. Even if the signal fails, still the VM workers are synchronized eventually.

To verify, run a test sequence (n4j-elb-tests) and check the log files on UFS to see if UnknownResourceFault is logged.

*Eucalyptus Version*

{{4.4.0-0.25788.147.20170202git6e5a63d.el7}}

Error showed in the UFS cloud logs (attached) when a load balancer servo instance wasn't found. Not sure the exact sequence of steps to produce this issue.  The cloud has been used exclusively for 4.4 verifications where 98% of the use cases deployed were an ELB+ASG stack.  

Example found in {{cloud-error.log}}:
{code}
...
Wed Feb 8 09:17:44 2017 ERROR [LoadBalancingActivitiesImpl:SWF Activity  LoadBalancerTasks 6627] [com.eucalyptus.loadbalancing.workflow.LoadBalancingActivitiesImpl.putCloudWatchMetri
cs(LoadBalancingActivitiesImpl.java):1476] Failed to lookup servo instance named: i-ede4d0d4

nceStatusPolling(LoadBalancingWorkflows.java):498] Failed to cancel instance-polling workflow

I think the reported issue is fixed in 4.4. For similar errors that are not polling related we should open separate issues.
[~hspencer], would you mind opening a separate ticket if this is a different issue?
The fix for the exception due to polling has been fixed. The same exception can be seen in other scenarios. Additional cleanup for those is filed in ticket EUCA-13261
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
